alert.note: Alert for Norman (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 18 at 11:05AM CDT until May 24 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota...North Dakota... Buffalo River near Dilworth affecting Clay County. Two Rivers River near Hallock affecting Kittson County. Sheyenne River at Valley City affecting Barnes County. Maple River near Mapleton (South of I-94) affecting Cass County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Minnesota... Snake River below Warren affecting Marshall County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota...North Dakota... Snake River AT Alvarado affecting Marshall County. Sheyenne River at Lisbon affecting Ransom County. Red River of the North at Halstad affecting Norman and Traill Counties. Red River of the North at Pembina affecting Kittson and Pembina Counties. Red River of the North at Drayton affecting Marshall, Kittson, Walsh and Pembina Counties. Red River of the North at Fargo affecting Cass and Clay Counties. Red River of the North at East Grand Forks affecting Polk and Grand Forks Counties. Red River of the North at Oslo affecting Walsh, Marshall, Polk and Grand Forks Counties. Wild Rice River (MN) at Hendrum affecting Norman County. Sheyenne River Diversion at West Fargo affecting Cass County. Sheyenne River at Harwood affecting Cass County. Sheyenne River near Kindred affecting Richland and Cass Counties. .Water levels continue to slowly drop at most river points. Additional rainfall expected over the next 24 hours will continue to slow the falling of river levels. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Red River of the North at Halstad. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 28.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 AM CDT Wednesday was 28.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 28.1 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 26.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
